data.title: Mike Miller - Head Coach - Women's Basketball Coaches
data.meta_description: The 2024-25 season will mark the 39th season with Mike Miller at the helm of the Messiah women's basketball program, a position that he began prior to the 1986-87
data.text:
The 2024-25 season will mark the 39th season with Mike Miller at the helm of the Messiah women's basketball program, a position that he began prior to the 1986-87 season.

NOTABLE MESSIAH ACCOLADES

759-255 overall record at Messiah

His winning percentage of .746 is the 16th highest winning percentage in NCAA DIII women’s basketball history

He is just the fifth NCAA DIII women's basketball coach to ever win 700 games and is second among active DIII women's basketball coaches

Two NCAA Division III Women’s Basketball National Runner-Up Finishes

2001 and 2008

23 NCAA Tournament Appearances

31-21 all-time Tournament Record (.696 winning %)

Two Final Four appearances

Three Elite Eight appearances

Eight Sweet 16 appearances

18 Second Round appearances

15 Conference Championships

2002, 2003, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008, 2010, 2014, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023

Seven-Time Regional Coach of the Year

2003, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021

Nine-Time Conference Coach of the Year

1995, 2000, 2001, 2003, 2007, 2008, 2018, 2019, 2021

Coached Four MAC Senior-Scholar

Eli Cook (2006), Kaitlyn Hoff (2018), Alecia Rohrer (2019), Leah Springer (2020)

Coached 11 Conference Players of the Year

Christina Vouriotis (2001, 2002, and 2003), Eli Cook (2005), Nikki Lobach (2007 and 2008), Dori Gyori (2013), Alecia Rohrer (2019), Leah Springer (2020, 2021, and 2022), Reese Harden (2024)

Coached One Conference Defensive Player of the Year

Jayneisha Davis (2021)

Coached Three Conference Rookie of the Year

Kris Vanderplatt (1994), Gillian Glackin (2014), Alecia Rohrer (2016)

Coached 21 D3hoops.com All-Region Honorees

Coached 11 D3hoops.com All-American Honorees

Coached 11 WBCA All-American Honorees

COACHING BIO

A 1983 Messiah graduate, Miller began coaching the Falcons in the 1986-87 season, his first as a collegiate head coach. He methodically led the program to national prominence, as the 1996 season was the program’s first 20-win campaign — producing an overall record of 20-8 — and first NCAA Tournament berth.

A coach set on teaching principles both on and off the court, Miller’s teams have always achieved in the classroom, evidenced by repeated appearances at the top of the Women’s Basketball Coaches Association Academic Top 25 Team Honor Roll.

Miller's integrity and dedication to women's basketball has given him the opportunity to serve as a member of the Commonwealth Conference Games Committee and as a member of the NCAA Ranking Committee. He currently serves as a WBCA MAC Commonwealth Captain and as a selection committee member for the prestigious WBCA Jostens Lifetime Achievement Award.

Mike and his wife of 40 years, Norma, live in Mechanicsburg, Pa. They have two children, Taylor Keener '14, and son Michael (Gordon College '12). Miller is also a grandfather of four grandchildren, Theo, Ellie, Lexi, and Isaac.

COACHING BY SEASON

MESSIAH WOMEN'S BASKETBALL

Season Overall Record Conference Record Conference Finish NCAA Appearance 1986-87 9-12 4-6 --- 1987-88 12-11 4-6 --- 1988-89 10-13 3-7 --- 1989-90 14-10 2-8 --- 1990-91 14-10 3-7 --- 1991-92 13-11 2-8 --- 1992-93 9-15 3-7 --- 1993-94 11-13 7-7 --- 1994-95 15-8 10-4 Quarterfinal --- 1995-96 20-8 10-4 Runner-Up Second Round 1996-97 13-11 6-8 --- --- 1997-98 17-8 10-4 Semifinal --- 1998-99 18-7 9-5 Semifinal --- 1999-00 22-6 13-1 Semifinal Second Round 2000-01 27-5 14-0 Runner-Up National Runner-Up 2001-02 23-4 12-2 Champion Second Round 2002-03 25-4 14-0 Champion Elite Eight 2003-04 23-4 14-0 Runner-Up Second Round 2004-05 25-4 12-2 Champion Sweet Sixteen 2005-06 26-3 13-1 Champion Second Round 2006-07 26-3 13-1 Champion Second Round 2007-08 30-3 10-0 Champion National Runner-Up 2008-09 23-5 11-1 Semifinal Second Round 2009-10 24-5 11-3 Champion Second Round 2010-11 19-8 12-2 Runner-Up First Round 2011-12 22-6 12-2 Semifinal Second Round 2012-13 25-5 16-2 Runner-Up Sweet Sixteen 2013-14 21-8 14-4 Champion Second Round 2014-15 13-13 9-7 Semifinal --- 2015-16 19-8 12-4 Runner-Up --- 2016-17 25-3 14-2 Champion First Round 2017-18 27-3 15-1 Champion Sweet Sixteen 2018-19 28-2 16-0 Champion Sweet Sixteen 2019-20 25-4 15-1 Champion Sweet Sixteen (halted for COVID) 2020-21 11-0 10-0 Champion -- No Tournament -- 2021-22 23-4 14-2 Champion First Round 2022-23 26-3 16-0 Champion Second Round 2023-24 23-6 13-1 Runner-Up Second Round Seasons: 38 759-255 398-120 15 Championships 2 National Runner-Ups .746 winning % .768 winning %
